7/7

Every American deserves an equal opportunity to vote. Yet the ongoing widespread and persistent voter discrimination throughout our country is only going to get worse, especially for minority voters. Congress must act where the Court has failed voters across the country.

4/

But in 2013, the Supreme Court gutted the #VotingRightsAct‚Äôs important enforcement mechanism known as "preclearance" in its disastrous Shelby County v. Holder ruling. This required states to ask the federal government's permission before making changes to voting laws.

3/

The #VotingRightsAct was a potent remedy for voter discrimination. Since its passage in 1965, Congress reauthorized and amended the VRA several times, on a bipartisan basis, to keep up with states and localities that continued to discriminate against their minority citizens.

2/

The Supreme Court has seriously eroded the #VotingRightsAct, the crown jewel of the civil rights movement and now the rise in voter suppression laws threatens the very foundation of our democracy.

The Warner-Portman-Sinema amendment will drive developers to create software outside of the U.S.

I urge my colleagues to oppose it and join me, @RonWyden, and @SenLummis in protecting American innovation.

Now isn‚Äôt the time for the IRS to pick winners and losers with a new technology. 

Crypto has the potential to be the future of the internet. 

How foolish to crush it over a tax provision that possibly raises just $500 million per year more in a $1.2 TRILLION bill.

We can all agree that centralized exchanges should be subject to the reporting requirement included in this bill, just like brokers would be subject to report other assets.

But why rush and get it wrong?

.@USTreasury wants maximum flexibility to regulate and tax crypto as they see fit. Congress should not allow that to happen.

We need to have this debate in public and in full, especially before potentially disruptive changes are made that push crypto overseas.

The Warner-Portman plan exempts bitcoin miners, but not other transaction validators or software developers who create these platforms.

What does that mean? Two identical services could receive dramatically different regulatory treatment depending on the technology used.

While I appreciate that my colleagues and the White House have acknowledged their original crypto tax had flaws, the Warner-Portman amendment picks winners and losers based on the type of technology employed. That‚Äôs horrible for innovation.

RT @RepGregoryMeeks My statement on @SECGov's approval for new board diversity standards and disclosures: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E8I6haGXMAYcRTM.png

I don't support everything in the bill.

That's not my standard for supporting a comprehensive piece of legislation.

But the good in it outweighs the bad, and the bad is being misconstrued by some on both sides.

Let's have a constructive debate, not talk past each other.

"It standardizes anti-drunk driving technology on all cars."

It begins a rulemaking process on how such technology would be implemented or regulated, and only on NEW cars.

No mandates on existing cars.

"It mandates every vehicle in the U.S. must have tracking devices."

There's a voluntary program to test how a Vehicle Miles Traveled tax would work.

There's no mandated tracking, and it will cost people nothing.

"We can't afford it."

While America's infrastructure has crumbled for decades, adversaries like China have been heavily investing in theirs, ready to take our place in the world economy when our infrastructure fails us.

It's an investment too important to ignore.

"It's filled with a liberal, woke agenda."

Roads, bridges, rail, transit, broadband, airports, resiliency, and permitting reform are bipartisan priorities.

71% of voters support this bill, including majorities of both parties.

"No one's read it."

The bill is based on three bipartisan bills committees have been working on for years.

It's not particularly new, and what is new has been debated thoroughly in recent days and weeks by the Senate.

"It's not a bill about infrastructure."

Its foundation is the @EPWGOP Surface Transportation Reauthorization Act, which invests hundreds of billions of federal dollars into roads and bridges.

"It'll increase inflation."
